intro: Chaetocarpus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a holly-like appearance. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chaetocarpus pubescens thrives in saline and sandy soils, making it well adapted to coastal environments.
